summary: About 2 million people in the U.S. live with the loss of all or part of an arm or leg. That number is expected to almost double by 2050. Adults over 65 are at greatest risk. People who've lost a limb can face higher mortality rates—often due to underlying conditions like diabetes or vascular disease. For beneficiaries who've lost a limb, Medicare covers some services...
title: Limb Loss: Rehabilitation Services and Outcomes for Medicare Beneficiaries
